meanings.definition: A unit of electric current in the International System of Units, equivalent to one coulomb per second.
meanings.sent1: Many devices require a specific amount of amperes to function properly.
meanings.sent2: The wire could only handle a few amperes of electricity before overheating.
meanings.sent3: The light bulb joked that it needed more amperes to shine brighter.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for the project was like a surge of amperes, powering through any obstacles.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the electric current was as loud as a thousand amperes rushing through the wires.

meanings.definition: The basic unit of electric current adopted under the Systeme International d'Unites.
meanings.sent1: Electricians use special tools to measure the flow of amperes in a circuit.
meanings.sent2: The power plant produced thousands of amperes of electricity every hour.
meanings.sent3: The toaster complained that it needed more amperes to toast the bread faster.
meanings.sent4: His determination to succeed was like a steady stream of amperes, never wavering.
meanings.sent5: The sensation of electricity running through his body was like a surge of amperes awakening his senses.
